weather_report:
In the soft, early hours of Thursday, Downtown San Francisco awakens under a muted ceiling of clouds, hinting at a lingering marine layer that still curls around the bay. The air carries a coolness typical of August mornings, with an easy breeze flowing through the streets, brushing against the skin just enough to remind us of the ocean's proximity. While there's only a slight chance of drizzle, the day promises moments when the clouds may part, revealing glimpses of a sun trying to break free and warm the city in the late morning.

As the day rolls on, we can expect a gradual transition. By afternoon, the clouds will yield to a mostly sunny disposition, though temperatures will hover in the comfortable mid-60s. It’s a day that invites layering—perhaps a light sweater or a light jacket for those early hours, which can be easily shed when the warmth begins to rise. Given the weather's temperate nature, a leisurely stroll along the waterfront might be perfect, or perhaps enjoying a quiet moment in a café with a warm drink, watching the world unfold against the backdrop of the iconic cityscape. Keep your eyes open for pockets where the sun shines through, illuminating the beauty that is ever-present in this city, even on its cloudiest days.
